column2: SeptraSick, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was prescribed the generic form of Septra DS for a UTI/Kidney Infection and am on day 8 of 10 of the medication (1 pill twice a day). I am experiencing extreme fatigue, body aches, neck pain, headache, and loss of appetite. I feel these side effects are not life threatening and will continue until I'm finished to fight off the infection, however, I don't know why they still prescribe this pill. It is horrible and makes me feel so sick.  Luckily, I am not nauseous - I don't think I'd be able to handle that. I am anxious to get retested for my infection and HOPE that this pill has done its job, especially since I've been put through hell by taking it. I am so sluggish at work all I want to do is stay in bed or soad in hot water to make my aches go away. I will NEVER again take this medicine. I wish I had known to ask the Dr. about the side effects, but just assumed since he prescribed it that they were mild.  Boy was I wrong. Good luck to those on it now.

column2: Angel54536, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was supposed to take this med for 3 weeks due to an infection diagosed as MRSA.  After about a week, all of a sudden I was getting sweating of my hair.  The hair on the back of my head was so wet you thought I just washed it.  I thought maybe I was going through memopause or something because it never happened before and I never had menopause but thought it migh be starting. About 3 days later I got flushed, perspired so all my clothes were wet and very clamy and again my hair was soaking wet.  When I got home I took my clothes off and every part of my body covered with clothes had a sporatic rash.  The rash now is on my whole torso.  I looks like a case of prickly heat that children get.  I went to Dr.  who looked at it and automatically said it was a typical allergic reaction to the Septra.  He said to stop taking the medication, gave me a shot of cortisone and said to take benedry over the counter.  That was Friday and today is Sunday.  I am no better.  Now I can't stand the itching and have to wait until tomorrow to see Dr.  I will never take this med again.  I have spayed bactine to try to ease itching.  Nothing is helping.  I stopped the Septra on Friday and this is Sunday so I know it must still be in my system. I am trying not to scratch but sometimes I have to give in.  Please if you get any indication about sweating or clamy, please stop taking before the rash occurs.  I don't want anyone to go through what I am going through.

Time will tell about the effectiveness, so far so good i give 4 stars, Ease of use 5 stars and Satisfaction I give 4 stars.
